title: @Riot Would you ever consider bringing back the pre-rework champs? Even in just a gamemode??
body:
I'd like the ability to play pre-rework Sion and Mordekaiser, but I know that you'll never just bring them back. So either make them playable during the next urf possibly, or we could create a new gamemode?

Imagine Ascension, but when you get ascended you change to a buffed pre-rework; Sion, Mordekaiser, Darius, Cassiopeia (V1 or V2 possibly both), Quinn, Malzahar, Anivia, Veigar etc. This would both require minimal effort (all things considered) and would revitalize both ascension and add a semi-new and fresh gamemode. Who wouldn't want to play for a chance of playing Mr. Get on my chopper himself. That's right frankenstein's axe-wielding monster Sion.

Season 5 Ryze?
I've been with this game from the very start of the beta. I played Ryze back then. He was a glass cannon mage that could utterly destroy you with Spell Flux 1v1, because it bounced between you and him and was super low CD. He practically won every trade like this.

I enjoyed his glass cannon state because that's what i consider mages to be - a lot of damage but basic survivability. I didn't like his mana battery rework and then AP tank rework. This one is a ton closer to how he used to be an i am not nostalgic about his old abilities, just what he used to be. Now he feels like a proper mage to me.

The whole point of a rework is to get rid of the toxic elements in a champion

there are also reworks to underpowered champions that are designed to make that champion broken for several patches (juggernaut update)

It's not about 'toxicity,' that's pretty unquantifiable, if you look at any of Riot's reworks they base it on "counterplay potential." I.e. Sion and Taric's old stuns couldn't be played around, same with LB Q silence, etc. 

People played with and against those champs for years in their un-counterplayable state and still had fun with the game; Riot just wanted to encourage more 1v1 "outplay" potential. It was a gameplay thing. 

So there's no argumentative reason they can't go back to pre-rework champs in a game mode; if I didn't want to face pre-rework LB, I wouldn't play in that game mode. There's nothing inherently "toxic" or bad about the way old champions were designed, I know a lot of people would have a blast reliving those old style champs. 

But if they don't have the data, they don't have the data, who knows.

Been thinking of this idea for months now...
"Patch Mode" gamemode consisted of all the champions and on the old Rift and whoever you pick is played at the stage of the FIRST EVER release patch.

>This would require minimal effort 

Can't really agree. It would require a ton of effort. Ensuring that the scripts governing abilities play nicely together is a major piece of Riot's work. Making all of these scripts from all across the game's history work together without bugging out horribly would be an ungodly amount of work. It would probably require more work than any game mode they've ever done before.

Besides, they didn't keep backups of the older changes. No real reason to.

I seriously doubt they don't have backups. 
"without bugging out horribly" 
That can be a "feature." Which I doubt would actually be a problem due to the simplicity of their kits.

Bugging out horribly very often results in crashes, which stop being funny really goddamn fast. Early pbe cycles with new or reworked champions are rife with them, and that's after riot has worked on them enough to prepare for a pbe release. Even if it doesn't crash, getting shit like being permanently disabled because of shitty interactions is not very amusing. This will happen. It happens for every new champion and rework because of how hard it is to get all the scripts to play nicely.

They have said they do not preserve full backups.

It won't ever happen. The problem is that they'd have to test every single pre- rework for every single game mode to make sure they weren't bugged.

On top of that, if a bug were to surface, the code would be complicated compared to champions nowadays.

This came up after the Garen VGU ruined Steel Legion Garen. Apparently Riot does not save models from old champions, so there is no way to easily bring back a pre-rework champion that got a Visual Update. Remember, all the old abilities had old particles, old icons, old animations.

This isn't a Gameplay question, its an art question. And the answer is 'no'.
